title: Members of the Trackyverse
text:
Hugo Flávio


  

Roles
Writing code and distributing tasks around :)
Currently the main developer of the ATO and atools packages. Maintaining actel too.

Projects

Roles
Keeper of the ATO dictionary, where central information about column names, data types, and functions is maintained.

title: R packages and tools for animal tracking
text:
This page is undergoing rapid development and serves as a splash page to direct you to the member projects. Check back here or on our R-universe page for further developments!





   
Interoperable S4 classes for animal tracking data. A rapidly-evolving package, so be sure to check out the manifesto to follow its guiding light.



Functions to filter, exlcude, and calculate various metrics housed in an ATO.



    
Designed for studies where animals tagged with acoustic tags are expected to move through receiver arrays. Combines the advantages of automatic sorting and checking of animal movements with the possibility for user intervention on tags that deviate from expected behaviour.



  
A revival of Bayesian spatial-point-process driven center-of-activity analyses from Winton et al. 2018.

title: R packages and tools for animal tracking
text:
Tools in the Trackyverse

vdat-docker
Need to use vdat from Innovasea’s Fathom Connect software on Linux or MacOS? Look no further. These Docker containers have all you need to get vdat to work.
